title: Blox Fruits: Everything You Need to Know About the Dragon Fruit

steps.title: The Dragon Fruit is currently not for sale.
steps.content: The Dragon Fruit is currently not for sale. As of Update 23 (which released December 25, 2023) the Dragon Fruit has been taken off sale so it can be enhanced and updated. Please note that the information below is accurate up to the time that Dragon Fruit was taken off sale, but the information will likely change once this fruit is put back in the game. [1] X Research source You can still trade Dragon Fruits, however. If you find someone willing to trade their Dragon Fruit for something you have, you can still obtain and use it while it's off sale.

steps.title: The Dragon Fruit was the third-most expensive fruit in the game.
steps.content: The Dragon Fruit was the third-most expensive fruit in the game. The Dragon Fruit is a Mythical Beast-type Blox Fruit that was available for purchase for $3,500,000 or 2,600 Robux from the Blox Fruit Dealer. The only two fruits that were more expensive than the Dragon Fruit were the Kitsune Fruit and Leopard Fruit .

steps.title: The Dragon Fruit was great at AoE damage and breaking instinct.
steps.content: The Dragon Fruit was great at AoE damage and breaking instinct. It had airborne long-range attacks, as well. Because of this, it was a great choice for PvP, especially if you're facing off against some air campers.

steps.title: Heatwave Beam (Z)
steps.content: Heatwave Beam ( Z ) Mastery cost: 1 Mastery Damage: 3591 Cooldown: 7.5 seconds Energy: 40 Description: You fire an energy beam from your mouth, which knocks back enemies and damages them. Transformed Heatwave Beam: You shoot an even larger fire beam from your mouth.

steps.title: Dragonic Claw (X)
steps.content: Dragonic Claw ( X ) Mastery cost: 150 Mastery Damage: 3770-5202 Cooldown: 10.5 seconds Energy: 60 Description: You create a ball of fire in your hand, then dash towards wherever the cursor is placed. If you make contact with an enemy you'll grab them and drag them with you. If you're in the air, you'll drag the enemy to the ground. After dropping the enemy, they will take nine ticks of burn damage. Transformed Dragonic Claw: You shoot three crescent-shaped fireballs from your claws. If these fireballs hit an enemy, they will take damage as well as burn tick damage.

steps.title: Fire Shower (C)
steps.content: Fire Shower ( C ) Mastery cost: 250 Mastery Damage: 853-5360 Cooldown: 15 seconds Energy: 100 Description: You leap into the air and shoot fireballs randomly at the ground. These fireballs explode when they hit the ground, which damages nearby enemies, knocks them back, and stuns them. If you press and hold this move you can fire more fireballs. Transformed Fire Shower: You shoot a huge fireball from your mouth, which explodes as soon as it touches something.

steps.title: Transformation (V)
steps.content: Transformation ( V ) Mastery cost: 350 Mastery Damage: n/a Cooldown: 1.5 seconds Energy: 10 Description: When you have a maxed out Fury Meter, you transform into a dragon. Transformed Transformation: When using transformation when you're transformed, you'll turn back into your humanoid form.

steps.title: Dragon Flight (F)
steps.content: Dragon Flight ( F ) Mastery cost: 75 Mastery Damage: n/a Cooldown: 5 seconds Energy: 50 Description: You grow dragon wings that allow you to fly.

steps.title: Fury Meter
steps.content: Fury Meter The Fury Meter allows you to transform into your dragon form. When you spawn in, your Fury Meter will be at 50%. The meter charges over time. To fully charge from 0% to 100%, it takes 1 minute and 30 seconds. When transformed, the Fury Meter will drain. It will also decrease when you use moves while transform, but will increase when you take damage while transformed.

steps.title: Dragon Armor
steps.content: Dragon Armor When transformed, you will get a huge damage resistance buff, and you can fly. This is separate from Dragon Flight, as Dragon Flight can't be used while transformed.

steps.title: Multicolored
steps.content: Multicolored You can change your Dragon Flight wings and dragon form's color by flying through colored hoops. These hoops are found around the Skylands in the First Sea, around the Ice Castle in the Second Sea, and near the Floating Turtle in the Third Sea. [2] X Research source Certain colors are only available if you have a certain amount of mastery: Default: Green, Blue, Red 100 Mastery: Orange 200 Mastery: Purple 300 Mastery: Brown 400 Mastery: Yellow 500 Mastery: White 600 Mastery: Black

steps.title: Pros
steps.content: Pros Easy to aim due to large hitboxes Allows you to be very mobile Does a decent amount of damage Great for ground PvP Good for grinding Third Sea bosses Can be used in trading thanks to its high value

steps.title: Cons
steps.content: Cons Currently not available Very expensive Low-level players will have a hard time meeting mastery requirements The dragon form is a huge and very visible target Fury Meter recharges slowly Fire Shower can be punishable when you're charging up
